text: Kurwa Railway Station (station code KURV) is at Kurwa village city in Dumka district in the Indian state of Jharkhand on the Jasidih – Rampurhat section. It is in the Howrah Division of the Eastern Railway Zone of the Indian Railway. It has an average elevation of . The railway line has single broad gauge track from Jasidih junction in Deoghar District in Santhal Pargana division of Jharkhand to Rampurhat in Birbhum District of West Bengal. This railway track to Dumka is a boon for Santhal Pargana Division. The Kurwa railway station provides rail connectivity to the nearby villages Ramidinda, Khayerbani, Rampur, Andipur, Guhiajori. ==History== Kurwa railway station became operational in 2014.
